---

Split out from #12937 (suggestions there applied here)

nodes.body: :v: ocfnash can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9180558111/job/25245257334)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9180558111/job/25245257890)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9180558111/job/25245258377)

After a bit more mulling over this, I'm wondering whether `extends` is the right choice. Maybe the triple should be a parameter. That seems to be how you use it in practice anyways. (And then `h e f` could possibly be implicit parameters.)

No strong opinion though.
Yeah I think I slightly prefer this; implemented in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13076/commits/dc3e7c5a4b8f4800df13b0f831b4c7b0292870cf

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: define `sl₂` triples and prove basic result

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Lie algebra root spaces are 1-dimensional

source.title: The roots of a Lie algebra are a root system.
